pullRequest.body:
which state the equivalency of `j = 0` and `c4 ^ 3 = 0` (and `c4 = 0` if the ring is reduced).

Also added `IsReduced.pow_(eq|ne)_zero[_iff]`, which generalizes the `pow_(eq|ne)_zero[_iff]` assuming `NoZeroDivisors`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [52aa3f5a63](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16974/commits/52aa3f5a639f37a862c7f87dcc64f1b696b6af09)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ j_eq_zero`
`+ j_eq_zero_iff`
`+ j_eq_zero_iff'`
`+ pow_eq_zero`
`+ pow_eq_zero_iff`
`+ pow_eq_zero_iff'`
`+ pow_ne_zero`
`+ pow_ne_zero_iff`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Thanks! Suggestions applied.

I found that ~I need some more lemma for specified characteristic case~ (turns out that they are not needed). For example, in char 3 case, j=0 if and only if b2=0. Is it a good idea to include such char specified lemma in this file?
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Ruben-VandeVelde.

@Multramate is this good to go? 

Also, please merge master and resolve the linter failures.

> I suppose there's also no need to add docstrings for the lemmas since they're kinda obvious what they do?

OK. Except for the results with a prime, which will be complained if without a docstring.
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Ruben-VandeVelde.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11096015585/job/30825353654)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11096015585/job/30825353726)
maintainer merge

It makes sense to me to merge this, at least.

maintainer merge
Thanks for your patience! I added minor golfs but I'm happy with this now. I suppose there's also no need to add docstrings for the lemmas since they're kinda obvious what they do?
maintainer merge
`lemma`? It's discussed somewhere that we might or might not reserve `theorem` for important theorems, but in any case the rest of this file follows the `lemma` convention.
Done.

```suggestion
  rw [j, Units.mul_right_eq_zero]
```
Done.
I'm not convinced we need the directional aliases, since we can just do `E.j_eq_zero_iff'.mpr` etc.
Fine.

Is there a scenario where we have a reduced ring but not an integral domain i.e. `NoZeroDivisors R`? I know that this is more general, but the proof is so much simpler with `NoZeroDivisors R`:
```
  rw [j_eq_zero_iff', pow_eq_zero_iff three_ne_zero]
```
Should we generalize `pow_eq_zero_iff` from `NoZeroDivisors` to `IsReduced`?
This sounds like a good idea!

> Is there a scenario where we have a reduced ring but not an integral domain i.e. `NoZeroDivisors R`?

I don't know, an artificial example is `R[X,Y]/(X,Y)`, but I don't know an example to consider elliptic curves on it.

> Should we generalize `pow_eq_zero_iff` from `NoZeroDivisors` to `IsReduced`?

Problem: `IsReduced` is not imported in that file.
Can we add `IsReduced.pow_(eq|ne)_zero[_iff]` in `Mathlib.RingTheory.Nilpotent.Defs` in this PR? I'm happy with this.

> Can we add `IsReduced.pow_(eq|ne)_zero[_iff]` in `Mathlib.RingTheory.Nilpotent.Defs` in this PR? I'm happy with this.

Sure.
Added.
You could use an alias like you did above, but again I don't think we need this, otherwise we'd have lots of directional lemmas for every iff statement.
This is not an alias of `j_eq_zero_iff` since it does not need `IsReduced` assumption.

Do you have an example where you need the unidirectional version, and not have a reduced ring? If you have this, you might as well have the unidirectional `j_ne_zero`, but again I don't think either is necessary.

> Do you have an example where you need the unidirectional version, and not have a reduced ring?

No, I don't have this example. But I strongly insist to keep this for the sake of completeness.
I'm also not convinced we need the contrapositive versions since you can just use `not_congr` whenever needed.
Plain `not_congr` produces `Â¬ E.j = 0 â†” Â¬ E.câ‚„ ^ 3 = 0`, which cannot `rw` the `E.j â‰  0`. So I prefer reserving the `ne` version.
I'm still not convinced by this. Could you give me an example where you need the negative forms in e.g. #16864?

> Could you give me an example where you need the negative forms

Sorry, but I don't have examples for now. Now #16864 does not depend on this PR anymore...
Fine. I think I'll remove this.

```suggestion
lemma j_eq_zero (h : E.câ‚„ = 0) : E.j = 0 := by
```

You could move this under `j_eq_zero` and use that to prove one direction like
```lean
  refine âŸ¨fun h â†¦ ?_, j_eq_zeroâŸ©
```

Untested:
```suggestion
  cases n <;> simp
```

Untested:
```suggestion
    x ^ n = 0 â†” x = 0 := âŸ¨pow_eq_zero, fun h â†¦ h.symm â–¸ zero_pow hnâŸ©
```

Untested:
```suggestion
  rw [j_eq_zero_iff', IsReduced.pow_eq_zero_iff three_ne_zero]
```

Can avoid the need for simp so hopefully a bit faster?
```suggestion
  rw [j_eq_zero_iff', h, zero_pow three_ne_zero]
```
I think this is `EllipticCurve.j_eq_zero_iff`?
Oh sorry.

BTW I do think your idea posted on Zulip of changing `EllipticCurve` into a `WeierstrassCurve` with an extra predicate (`IsElliptic`/`IsSmooth`/`IsNeZeroDisc`? Rather than have it be an extended structure) is fantastic, and would prevent issues like this in the future, but I haven't got around it. Have you made any attempts at this?

> Have you made any attempts at this?

Not yet. Maybe I'll try later.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(AlgebraicGeometry/EllipticCurve/Weierstrass): add `j_eq_zero[_iff][']`
